intro: Paragonia pyramidata, commonly known as the pyramid bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, often appearing in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant among horticulturists.
